trans-unit.source: Enable database class loading with a property

seg-source.mrk: Enable database class loading with a property

target.mrk: Enable database class loading with a property

trans-unit.source: Once you have added one or more jar files to a database, you must set the database jar classpath by including the jar file or files in the derby.database.classpath property to enable to load classes from the jar files.

seg-source.mrk: Once you have added one or more jar files to a database, you must set the database jar classpath by including the jar file or files in the derby.database.classpath property to enable to load classes from the jar files.

target.mrk: Once you have added one or more jar files to a database, you must set the database jar classpath by including the jar file or files in the derby.database.classpath property to enable to load classes from the jar files.

trans-unit.source: This property, which behaves like a classpath, specifies the jar files to be searched for classes and resources and the order in which they are searched. If <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not find a needed class stored in the database, it can retrieve the class from the user's classpath. (<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> first looks in the user's classpath before looking in the database.)

seg-source.mrk: This property, which behaves like a classpath, specifies the jar files to be searched for classes and resources and the order in which they are searched.
If <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not find a needed class stored in the database, it can retrieve the class from the user's classpath.
(<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> first looks in the user's classpath before looking in the database.)

target.mrk: This property, which behaves like a classpath, specifies the jar files to be searched for classes and resources and the order in which they are searched.
If <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> does not find a needed class stored in the database, it can retrieve the class from the user's classpath.
(<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> first looks in the user's classpath before looking in the database.)

trans-unit.source: Separate jar files with a colon (<codeph>:</codeph>).

seg-source.mrk: Separate jar files with a colon (<codeph>:</codeph>).

target.mrk: Separate jar files with a colon (<codeph>:</codeph>).

trans-unit.source: Use fully qualified identifiers for the jar files (schema name and jar name).

seg-source.mrk: Use fully qualified identifiers for the jar files (schema name and jar name).

target.mrk: Use fully qualified identifiers for the jar files (schema name and jar name).

trans-unit.source: Set the property as a database-level property for the database.

seg-source.mrk: Set the property as a database-level property for the database.

target.mrk: Set the property as a database-level property for the database.

trans-unit.source: See "derby.database.classpath" in the for more information about the property.

seg-source.mrk: See "derby.database.classpath" in the for more information about the property.

target.mrk: See "derby.database.classpath" in the for more information about the property.

trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s class loader looks first in the user's classpath for any needed classes, and then in the database. To ensure class loading with the database class loader, remove classes from the classpath.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s class loader looks first in the user's classpath for any needed classes, and then in the database.
To ensure class loading with the database class loader, remove classes from the classpath.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>'s class loader looks first in the user's classpath for any needed classes, and then in the database.
To ensure class loading with the database class loader, remove classes from the classpath.
